summary: This is a brief email exchange from April 4, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, inquiring about a ruling from a Chief Magistrate (CM) regarding the Epstein case. It indicates internal coordination on the matter.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: The sender of the email inquiring about a ruling from CM regarding Epstein, from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Internal Email Inquiry on Epstein Ruling
events.description: An email is sent within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York inquiring if a ruling was received from a Chief Magistrate (CM) regarding the Epstein case.

keyFacts: An internal email from April 4, 2019, shows the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively seeking a ruling from a Chief Magistrate (CM) regarding the Epstein case.
The email originates from the Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, indicating the case involved coordination within that specific unit.
The tone 'We wait with bated breath' suggests anticipation or urgency regarding the magistrate's decision.
